page.title: 05CHANGING LILLIESLEAF
page.content: THE BUSES WENT FROM SELKIRK TO HAWICK AND YOU WALKED TO ASHKIRK OR GREENHILL TO CATCH THE BUSES CALLED"{THE WEE {TERI}"AND"{THE WEE SOUTER}".IN THE EARLY 1920'S FEW PEOPLE OWNED MOTOR CARS.YOU WALKED TO LILLIESLEAF TO CATCH THE BUS AT TEN AND GET THE TWO O CLOCK OR FIVE O CLOCK BUS HOME ONLY ON THURSDAYS OR SATURDAYS. THE ROAD FROM LILLIESLEAF TO SELKIRK WENT A DIFFERENT WAY.IT WENT DOWN BY THE FOOTBALL FIELD, DOWN TO RIDDELL MILL, CROSSED THE RIVER BY THE FORD BELOW RIDDELL TOWER, ALONG THE BACK OF RIDDELL HOUSE,PAST RIDDELL COTTAGE AND MET THE ROAD AT THE BACK OF CLERKLANDS. THE ROAD ALTERED IN 1800. THE{CHURCH}USED TO HAVE A BIGGER CONGREGATION BECUASE IT WAS A VERY CLOSE KNIT POPULATION SO THE MINISTER HAD A STRICT CONTROL OVER YOU.
